ecotools 1.0.2

Summary of presence/absence observations

obs_sum.Rd

obs_sum() takes a data frame of field data and prints a summary of the frequency of "present" vs. "absent" observations.

Usage

obs_sum(data, binary_col)

Arguments

data

Binary field data.

binary_col

Binary data - ones and zeroes. Entered as "column_name".

Value

A string printed in the console giving the fraction and percentage of "present" and "absent" observations.

Examples

# Example data frame containing a column of binary data
df <- data.frame(binary_col = c(1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0))

# Calculating a printing the percentage of each type of observation
obs_sum(df, binary_col)
#> present: 4/8; 50%
#> absent: 4/8; 50%
